ploom 0.0

Complete model for IRLS iteration

end_weight.Rd

Update variables used for IRLS calculation, increment iter, and determine if model has converged

end_weight(object, tolerance = 1e-07)

Arguments

object

oomglm() model.
tolerance

Tolerance for change in coefficient as a multiple of standard error.

See also

iter_weight()

Examples

# initiate `oomglm()` model and `oom_data()`
x <- oomglm(mpg ~ cyl + disp)
chunks <- oom_data(mtcars, chunk_size = 10)

# manually perform one round of IRLS and check results
x <- init_weight(x)
x <- weight(x, data = chunks)
x <- end_weight(x)

print(x$converged)
#> [1] FALSE
print(coef(x))
#> (Intercept)         cyl        disp 
#> 34.66099474 -1.58727681 -0.02058363 

# manually perform an additional round of IRLS
x <- init_weight(x)
x <- weight(x, data = chunks)
x <- end_weight(x)

print(x$converged)
#> [1] TRUE
print(coef(x))
#> (Intercept)         cyl        disp 
#> 34.66099474 -1.58727681 -0.02058363 

# the IRLS process as implemented by `iter_weight()`
# is similar to the following
x <- oomglm(mpg ~ cyl + disp)
chunks <- oom_data(mtcars, chunk_size = 10)

while(!x$converged) {

  x <- init_weight(x)
  x <- weight(x, data = chunks)
  x <- end_weight(x)

}

tidy(x)
#> # A tibble: 3 x 7
#>   term        estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low  conf.high
#>   <chr>          <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>      <dbl>
#> 1 (Intercept)  34.7       2.55       13.6  4.02e-14  29.5     39.9     
#> 2 cyl          -1.59      0.712      -2.23 3.37e- 2  -3.04    -0.131   
#> 3 disp         -0.0206    0.0103     -2.01 5.42e- 2  -0.0416   0.000395
